welcome.header: WELCOME TO THE SHERIFF OF NOTTINGHAM TUTORIAL
welcome.description: In this tutorial, you'll learn the game mechanics by trying them yourself.
features: Try different choices to see all possible outcomes
Replay scenarios as many times as you want
Skip ahead when you understand a concept
Experiment without consequences (tutorial stats don't carry over)
welcome.encouragement: Don't worry about making mistakes - that's how you learn!

scenarios.name: Honest Hannah
scenarios.intro: A straightforward merchant with legal goods

learning_points.pass:
GOOD CHOICE! Letting honest merchants pass builds your reputation (+1).
Honest merchants are your allies - treat them well!
learning_points.inspect:
OOPS! She was honest. You owe her an 8g penalty and lose reputation (-1).
Inspecting honest merchants damages your authority and costs you gold.
learning_points.threaten:
She refuses to negotiate (she's honest and has nothing to hide).
You must decide: inspect her anyway or let her pass.

learning_points.pass:
BAD CHOICE! He smuggled 3 crossbows worth 45g! You lose reputation (-2).
Always watch for nervous tells - they often indicate lies.
learning_points.inspect:
EXCELLENT! You caught him with 3 crossbows. Reputation +2, earned confiscation value.
Catching smugglers is your primary job and builds your authority.
learning_points.threaten:
He nervously offers to increase the bribe to 20g.
You can accept the higher bribe or inspect him anyway.
learning_points.accept_bribe:
You earned 15g but your reputation drops (-1).
Bribes are profitable but accepting them damages your authority over time.

scenarios.name: Clever Silas
scenarios.intro: A strategic merchant with an interesting offer

learning_points.pass:
SAFE CHOICE! He had legal goods. Reputation +1.
Sometimes the safest move is to let them pass.
learning_points.inspect:
TRICKED! All legal goods - you owe him a 20g penalty. Reputation -1.
He baited you into inspecting! Some merchants are very clever.
learning_points.threaten:
He calmly says: 'Inspect if you want, Sheriff. I have nothing to hide.'
His confidence is suspicious... or is it?
learning_points.accept_bribe:
CLEVER PLAY! You earned 30g and he had legal goods anyway.
But your reputation still drops (-1) from accepting bribes.

ADVANCED STRATEGY: Some merchants bribe even with legal goods
to build goodwill, test you, or make you look corrupt!

scenarios.narrator_note:
This scenario teaches an advanced concept: Not all bribes mean contraband!
Strategic merchants may offer bribes with legal goods to manipulate you.
